summary: Build DreamDestination, a full-stack travel website with a React (HTML/CSS/JS) frontend and a Node.js/Express + MongoDB backend, expanding to include an owner-only admin panel and flight/train booking features.
architectural_notes: Tech stack: React frontend (HTML/CSS/JS) + Node.js/Express backend + MongoDB database.
Add role-based access control: restrict admin panel actions to the site owner/admin account.

existing_features.title: Create a DreamDestination travel website frontend in React + TypeScript with Tailwind styling, including a responsive layout with top navigation and footer, and the following pages/routes: Home, Destinations (list), Destination Details, and Contact.
Implement a coherent visual theme for DreamDestination (colors, typography, spacing, components style) and apply it consistently across all pages.
Add frontend data fetching with React Query to load destinations from the backend, display them in the Destinations list, and show full details on the Destination Details page.
Implement a Contact form on the frontend (name, email, message) that submits to the backend, and a backend API to store contact inquiries for later review.
Generate and integrate required static images for the DreamDestination brand and UI (logo and hero imagery) and reference them as static assets in the frontend.
Add an About page to the DreamDestination frontend, including a new route at "/about" and a new page component.
Add a Login page to the DreamDestination frontend, including a new route at "/login" and a new page component that uses the existing Internet Identity hook to let users sign in and sign out.

Update the shared site navigation (desktop header nav, mobile menu, and footer quick links) to include links to the new "/about" and "/login" pages, alongside the existing Home, Destinations, and Contact links.
Create a new frontend page and route for booking at "/booking" that lets a signed-in user create a flight or train booking by entering From, To, Date, Time, and Passengers.
Add React Query hooks and UI integration to submit bookings to the backend and show the signed-in user's booking history on the Booking page.
Update the shared site navigation (header, mobile menu, and footer quick links) to include a link to the new Booking page at "/booking".

Integrate booking into the Destination Details page by adding a “Book flight/train” section that lists available transport options for that destination, including schedule details and current available seats, and allows the user to start booking from the destination page.

Update the Booking page and React Query hooks to support destination-linked bookings: allow pre-filling the booking UI from a selected destination transport option, display full option details (including seat availability), and successfully create the booking via the updated backend API.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create DreamDestination travel website: React (HTML/CSS/JS) frontend plus Node.js/Express backend with MongoDB.

Implement backend canister APIs (Motoko, single actor) to support managing destinations: list destinations, get destination by id, and (for initial content) seed a small default set of destinations when empty.
Add an About page/route to the DreamDestination frontend navigation.
Add a Login page/route (basic authentication UI flow) to the DreamDestination frontend.
Add an owner-only admin panel to manage site data (add/edit/delete destinations, tours, and review inquiries).
Implement booking features for flights and trains (search by from/to/date/time/passengers, results list, details, booking flow, store bookings, and show user booking history).
Add backend support for saving and retrieving user bookings (flights and trains) in the existing Motoko single-actor canister, associating each booking with the authenticated caller principal.
Integrate booking with destination details: allow users to book flights/trains directly from a destination page and show full schedule details including seat availability (empty seats).

Add backend support for destination-linked transport options (flights and trains) that include schedule details and seat availability, so the frontend can display when a flight/train departs and how many seats are still available for a given destination.

Update backend booking creation to support booking a specific flight/train option for a destination and to enforce seat availability (reduce available seats when a booking is made and reject bookings that exceed remaining seats).
